primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The expansion of the erotic experience of 'the Great All' into a universal state of being (Agape) through human realization.

tekstueel_bewijs: Ich habe mich kennengelernt als jemanden, der zu dem großen Alles fähig war
Der in der geglückten Beziehung Lebende ist auch fähig...
Weniger als alles kann den Menschen nicht befriedigen
an deren Folgen wir alle leiden
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Subject (the one who must expand their love).

helper.identificatie: Successful Erotic Relationships / The concept of 'God'
tekstueel_bewijs: Das Wort GOTT ist eine Vokabel, um diese Erotisierung des Ganzen auszudrücken
helper.rol_van_god: God is a semantic tool (Helper/Vocabulary), not the Subject.

tekstueel_bewijs: die sexistische menschenfeindliche Tradition des Christentums
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is a historical/ideological construct that hinders human self-realization.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The dismantling of hierarchical power structures through love.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Lover
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical outcome is fused with the psychological experience of love.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Human Need → The Great All → The Self
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Erotic Experience → The Human → Religious Tradition

voorbeelden_mens_subject: Ich habe mich kennengelernt als jemanden, der...

voorbeelden: Ich verstehe das Christentum als eine Anleitung
jemanden, der zu dem großen Alles fähig war

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a recruitment of desire. It assumes the human already has the 'Pouvoir' (power) through erotic experience and only needs the 'Vouloir' (will) to expand it.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Tradition) to ~S2 (Critique) to S1 (The Eroticized All).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the semantic redefinition of 'God' as a synonym for human erotic wholeness.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Low. Judgment/Sin is replaced by 'bad traditions' or 'unsuccessful relationships'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While it avoids traditional legalism, it is profoundly anthropocentric. The human is the subject of all transformative action; God is reduced to a 'vocabulary word' for human experience.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Ich habe mich kennengelernt als jemanden, der zu dem großen Alles fähig war.
Das Wort GOTT ist eine Vokabel, um diese Erotisierung des Ganzen auszudrücken.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: weil ihm das große Alles entgegenkam

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The preacher uses their own erotic experience as the primary model for the hearer to emulate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God is the one who loves 'everything' (1 Cor 13) perfectly in Christ, and we are the receivers of that love when we fail to love.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Self-empowerment or exhaustion (if the erotic 'All' is not currently felt).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is highly coherent as a secular-humanist manifesto, but incoherent as a Christian proclamation of grace.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'overwhelming demand' of the text and the claim that we are already 'capable' of it.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Ich verstehe das Christentum als eine Anleitung, das Leben so zu leben...

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The human finds competence in erotic success, not the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as 'fragmentation' or 'sexism' rather than a condition requiring a Savior.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'Subject-switch' where the human ego takes the place of God as the primary actor of 1 Cor 13.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The preacher/hearer is the subject of 'bearing all things'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Christ as the only one who 'bore all things' on the cross.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Christus ist derjenige, der alles ertragen hat, damit wir, die wir oft an der Liebe scheitern, neu geliebt werden.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Position the hearer as the one who is 'believed in' and 'hoped for' by God.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Excessive Pouvoir (Ability) based on human experience.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Focus on God's Pouvoir to transform the dead heart.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Contrast our inability to love the 'unlovable' with God's power to do so.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Death and the 'Hard Heart' as cosmic opponents.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Without a heavy opponent, grace is just a 'good vibe'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (how to love) has swallowed Soteriology (how we are loved).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. God loves us (Soteriology). 2. Therefore, we can love (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically beautiful but structurally replaces the Gospel with a romantic-humanist psychology.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is persuasive and inclusive; actantially, it is a closed loop of human effort.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would find that 1 Cor 13 is a critique of human pride; this sermon uses it to bolster human capacity.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that 'God' is merely a 'Helper' or 'Object' in this text, never the 'Subject'.

appendices.notities: The sermon represents a 'Feuerbachian' turn where theology is translated into anthropology without remainder.
